documents.document: @jmodoh @jo_moir Ah grasshopper. Life's successes are not determined by how you travel but where you get off.
@jmodoh Save your sledging for when you're winning. How did an ocker get so snobbish?
Ah Wellington as the hottest month of the year kicks off. Shall I compare it to a summer's day? Yeah, nah. https://t.co/BMFxhxMdN1
Maybe I'm being unfair but on the face of it Thiel's citizenship documents remind me of nothing so much as an honorary university degree.
Thiel resided as a permanent resident in NZ over 5 years for (redacted) days. Looks like the black ink covers two digits.
Thiel did not meet "presence in NZ" or "intention to continue to reside". Exceptional circumstances = enterpreneurship and philanthropy
Officials reveal businessman Peter Thiel attended a private citizenship ceremony at the New Zealand Consulate in Santa Monica in August 2011
English nominates the 'Goldilocks' election date: https://t.co/wk6XzXNPuq
@robhosking @philiplyth kind. Did pick Sept 23 last yr and more recently but deservedly punished for wavering when English first took over.
June 23 is start of regulated period for election advertising spending says Electoral Commission.
English talking a balance of infrastructure, spending, debt reduction and income improvements across the board. So family tax package on!?
English refuses to rule anything in or out when it comes to Winston Peters as deputy PM.
English says NZ First an unlikely partner but he would be prepared to talk to them depending on the outcome of the election
English says National will have an ambitious and positive programme for the Sept 23 election.
Election date is September 23
Does the date really matter. Only if it's really early or late ... and because it is a nerd-off between pundits.
Speculating whether a spring winter or summer campaign is best. Then we realised all dates are winter campaigns in Wellington
"Cullen" Super Fund earned 13.2% in 2016. Worth $32.7 billion, > twice the $14.88b Govt has put in. Annual return of 9.9% since inception.
Morgan Foundation's CoS Geoff Simmons to stand in the Mt Albert by-election for Gareth Morgan's Opportunites Party to :"Make NZ fair again".
Unemployment rate rose to 5.2% in December 2016 quarter (up from 4.9% in the previous 1/4) while employment and labour force grew - Stats NZ
Ministry staffer alleged to have helped foreign firm prepare licence application https://t.co/icL0jlNCG8
@JohnJCampbell indeed. May have missed the plane but that might have been the wiser option- though tracked the win on cricinfo in the taxi!
I left the ground to head to the airport when Aust were nine down. This may have been a strategic error.
@jmodoh @CTrevettNZH He is ducking well. Wish you were here.
@metcalph Outwards and flipped upwards ... since you ask! Sort of comb-forward flap maybe?
Revelation1 from State of Nation speeches: Sign language for Donald Trump is a hand flipped up on the forehead like (an orange) lock of hair
@jmodoh @DeborahMTNZ We can't all wear a suit every waking hour, mate.
There seems to be general enthusiasm for Turei's idea of Andrew Little as the next PM at the joint Labour-Green state of the nation speeches
Metiria Turei delivering opening speech at joint state of the nation with Andrew little - as the Spark comms issues seem to get resolved!
Jo Goodhew drops out of Rangitata election contest https://t.co/TobP4vG89X
@jmodoh Why, thank you. May I help in return with the day of the week. It's Tuesday.
The minimum wage will rise by 50c to $15.75 an hour on April 1. The starting-out and training rate will go from $12.20 to $12.60 an hour.
Trump signals one-on-one trade deals with NZ, TPP countries https://t.co/4s0fUQuXpu
@rumpole3 @philquin But is there one fool?

@ChrisEichbaum Have you looked at Moolah which was advertising on tv the other day. AIR 51 to 547%

"[As a] busy politician + family man you don't have time for skeletons, you're just in the closet trying to find the other shoe." PM English

Enjoy the breeze that's on the way. Son has bailed out for the capital! https://t.co/msvy7rkB7b

The NZ Govt plans to ban the sale or manufacture of personal care products containing plastic microbeads, Environment Min Nick Smith says
@Hilary_Barry Very jealous - was there last week but they were a no show for us. I guess the weather was too bad even for them!
What ever happened to the recheck lane at vehicle testing @vtnz? Another long wait for quick OK puts you off using them again.
@BarristerNZ it looks like it only a couple are concentrating.
@mrfreemannz @damienmgrant The hours of pain ... it feels only like yesterday. Maybe veterans' lightning chess?
Ah yes now I remember. The NZ Chess Championships Wellington 2017 is winding up today. https://t.co/nJlNLbSVDl
That's very sad news. A thoroughly kind and erudite man. https://t.co/z2D5vStRIB
@Selwyn_Manning Cold. cold ... so cold ... losing consciousness ...
Ah a roaring fire in the Speights ale house a hint of sleet and 9deg outside. A great Summer's day in Invercargill.
Heading to far south and Stewart Island this week for "summer" holiday as forecast warns of frosts. Is there a word, or an emoji for that?
Israel's reaction to the UN resolution plus threats reminiscent of "fog in the channel, Europe cut off" joke from the UK in the 50s.
Nelson's Saxton Oval. Where bowling averages go to die eh? Looking forward to that. https://t.co/c2t7tZyK5l
Just paid $7 more for an Air NZ ticket to invercargill than it would have cost to get to Tahiti. Will be good to see younger son though.
Why am I looking for political symbolism in this? Why? It's summer holiday for @&"0 sake. https://t.co/swQoClphVP
Seems China knew about the steel dumping probe on Monday. https://t.co/NutlInwdFq
@StephenJacobi I see the report in the Chinese media and your approval of them as following WTO rules. Hardly = MBIE opening informing NZ?
@StephenJacobi I don't think gazetting something without a press release shows huge commitment to openness do you?
@StephenJacobi where?
So MBIE quietly slips out just before Xmas its decision to hold an inquiry into Chinese steel dumping.
Labour (Ardern) versus Greens (probably Genter) in Mt Albert - seems to offer tactical National voters intriguing options for mischief.
@michaelcolhoun I am bereft of an answer.
Room for confusion over ministers Paula Bennett and David Bennett.when we use surnames only. Might I respectfully suggest B1 and B2?
@LynnGrieveson @BrookSabin I reckon. Just seemed incredibly tame alongside Brook's catalogue of wildlife ...
Found myself watching demolition of 61 Molesworth St while I wait for my lift home. You gotta make your own festive fun Mum always said.
@BrookSabin excellent. We nearly ran over a tortoise in the south of Greece - sigh.
@DavidClarkNZ Yea I know. When I get a few more years under my belt ...
Trying to decide if Todd Barclay that popular in caucus, given the Twitter love on his re-selection...or if MPs just don't like challenges.
National list MP Nuk Korako has been re-selected in the Port Hills electorate for 2017, where Labour's Ruth Dyson is the sitting MP.
Steven Joyce aka Pool Shark. is lining up tax thresholds but warns of overseas threats to rosy economic outlook https://t.co/rDcsd3uhU6
@felixmarwick yep - that's the return match
If Finance Minister Steven Joyce casually suggests a game of bar room pool, be very cautious ....
For thems who cares; Roy Morgan poll puts Nats down 4.5% to 45, Lab up 5.5 to 28.5, Greens 14.5, NZ First at 7.5%. Maori 1, Act 0.5, UF 0%.
@toby_etc @robhosking Don't try yr pro-intellectual snobbery here mate. Check out how many Nat lost to Lab on party vote (non-Maori seats).
@toby_etc @robhosking @jgmccl More to the point why quote a party vote when electorate vote went another way and this is an electorate vote?
Suggest headline should be 45% of Americans not bothered ... https://t.co/3uq3PMjOma
National will not run a candidate in Mt Albert byelection on Feb 25 says PM English
Definitely way to go. And they cite small claims tribunal wrongly when there's no precedent value even if there areâ€¦ https://t.co/K4wM7LrYDa

And every colleague/academic/pundit has probably gone: Meh. https://t.co/Rl5wnupGaQ
Confess to feeling a bit antsy. More than 24 hours and no ministerial career-ending announcements.
Former GG Sir Jerry Mateparae confirmed as our High Commissioner in London
Foreign Minister Murray McCully confirms he will not be back after the 2017 election.
The House has risen for Xmas. It passed 107 bills; 98 Govt, 4 members 3 prvte and 2 local .There were 1055 oral and 15,445 written questions
Minister Craig Foss joins the conga line of exiting MPs
David Shearer follows Phil Goff's lead and has one last nostalgic meal on Copperfields https://t.co/iiEEXDvf7I
Does Stuart Nash know he is in shot on Parliament TV? A study in wanting to be somewhere else.
The Cabinet reshuffle two-step begins. Sam Lotu-Iiga will not seek re-election in 2017. Does that mean Alfred Ngaro gets ethnic affairs?.
Govt bosses pay: Av increase base pay Public Service CEs: 1.3%. Crown entity CEs: 3.4%. PSCE salaries 5.5 X employees. Cost of PSCEs $14.3m
John Key: I'm the kind of person who likes to be liked."
So it's farewell from John Key. His last stand up on the tiles as PM. https://t.co/DUBeM4fUC9
English signals he is unlikely to take a portfolio a la Key and tourism.
Bill English does a bit of Lit Crit crossed with social commentary on his "digging up diamonds" quote from a poem.
English says he will deal in the new year with the election date but will not be driven by Labour's internal problems.
English says he is not making the same pledge (to quit if superannuation changes) as John Key.
English says "I don't think gay marriage is a threat to anyone else's marriage ...in some ways it's an affirmation of the concept."
English says on the word stage NZ will maintain the role of "honest broker".
Cabinet reshuffle will be later this week and certainly before Christmas says Bill English. "There will be change."
PM-elect English quotes poem "lead and dig up the diamonds around you".
